C3: Computes a primitive root modulo $p$.
Computes the smallest primitive root modulo $p$.
Computes the smallest primitive root modulo m for all $m$ with $m1 \le m \le m2$.
Counts the number of primitive roots modulo m for all $m$ with $m1 \le m \le m2$.
Computes the modular inverse of $a$ modulo $p$, i.e. an integer $b$ with $ab \equiv 1$ mod $p$.
Computes integers $g,$ $u,$ and $v$ such that $g = \gcd(a,b) = ua + vb.$
Compute the power $a^k$ mod $n$.
Computes $x$ such that $a^x \equiv y$ mod $m$. Employs a brute force algorithm.
computes $\lfloor \sqrt{a} \rfloor$ over the integers.
Computes an integer $b$ such that $b^2 \equiv a$ mod $p$. Here, $p$ must be a prime number.
Computes all integers $b$ such that $b^2 \equiv a$ mod $n$.
Count subprimitive polynomials for $q \le Q\_max$
Compute the character table of the symmetric group of degree n.
Compute generators for a subgroup of $\PSL(2,q)$ isomorphic to $\Alt(5).$
Computes the order ${\rm ord}(q,n)$ of $q$ modulo $n$ for all $n$ with $n_{\min} \le n \le n_{\max}$ for which $\gcd(n,q) = 1$. Also computes $\varphi(n)$ and $\varphi(n)/{\rm ord}(q,n)$.
Compute Euler's totient function $\varphi(n)$ for all n with $n1 \le n \le n2.$
Compute the Young symmetrizer in the symmetric group of degree n.
Compute the Young symmetrizer in the symmetric group of degree 4.
Draw a diagram with $n$ vertices equally spaced out on a circle.
Compute all rational normal forms of elements in $\GL(d,F)$, where $F$ is a field.
Compute the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a matrix.
Computes the Jacobi symbol $\left( \frac{a}{p} \right)$
Compute the Smith Normal Form of the matrix M.
